thread.title: Origin Energy launches $2.5bn share offer plans to reduce dividend | Business News | Business Finance News
thread.title_full: Origin Energy launches $2.5bn share offer and plans to reduce dividend | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: Origin Energy launches $2.5bn share offer plans to reduce dividend | Business News | Business Finance News
text:
The company said it planned to reduce capital expenditure and working capital requirements this financial year and next by $1bn and would target up to $800 million of non-core asset sales by fiscal 2017. Origin provided dividend guidance of 20c per share for fiscal 2016 and 2017.
“These initiatives will lower debt, strengthen the balance sheet and reduce reliance on distributions from Australia Pacific LNG,” Origin chairman Gordon Cairns said in a statement to the ASX.
“We believe this package of initiatives is prudent in light of current market conditions and strikes a reasonable balance in the best interest of all shareholders.”
At current market forward oil prices and exchange rates the company’s net debt to underlying earnings is expected to be “comfortably below” a multiple of four times in fiscal 2017, reducing to three times in subsequent years, he said.
The sale of assets will include non-operated upstream interests and direct investments in assets for wind generation, as well as infrastructure assets such as pipelines that requiring tolling arrangements.
The company’s shares were placed on a trading halt ahead of the competition of the four-for-seven fully under written renounceable entitlement offer.
Shares will be offered at $4, representing a 34.4 per cent discount to the last closing price yesterday, the company said.
Origin reported a loss of $658 million in the 12 months to June 30, against last year's net profit of $530 million as the result was hit by writedowns amid weak commodity prices. The company announced an unchanged final dividend of 25c unfranked, payable on September 28.
 Origin launches $2.5bn share offer
